region_description: The Great Wall of China, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is one of the most significant and impressive feats of ancient engineering. Spanning over 13,000 miles, it was constructed over several dynasties, primarily to protect against invasions and raids. The wall's construction began in the 7th century BC, with the most well-known sections built during the Ming Dynasty (1368-1644). Today, the Great Wall is a symbol of China's enduring strength and resilience, attracting millions of visitors each year. Hiking along the wall offers breathtaking views of the surrounding landscapes and a unique opportunity to explore the rich history of China.
